column3: This should also take care of the issue for non-gitian users.\n
Can I get an ACK from Matt?\n
ACK if @laanjw says it doesnt break anything when built on Win32.\n
Shouldn't we actually pass MINGW_THREAD_BUGFIX to qmake somewhere in the gitian file?\n
Its on by default, so it doesnt matter...\n

```
QMAKE_LIBS_QT_ENTRY -= -lmingw32
```

This causes an undefined reference to Winmain@16 when building in Qt Creator in Windows.

Any specific reason why are you subtracting it? Is mingwthrd supposed to be a full replacement for mingw32? (I don't think so)
What if we add -lmingw32 onto the end of LIBS (after -lmingwthrd)?\n

Also tried. Same problem.

Every time I add the `-= -lmingw32` line it fails...
What link command is it trying to use, with the last 3 lines I posted?\n

Aha, great. Really too bad qmake doesn't have a prefix operator, though.

Can anyone test that this creates a secure build when cross-compiling? (Otherwise, I can do it when 0.4 rc is done building)
Found a way to do a prefix. @laanwj, please test on native Windows. I'm doing a cross-gitian build now.\n
ACK, the build @luke-jr gave me to test worked fine.\n
Rebase into one commit? And a final ACK from @laanwj ?\n
